text: No consensus exists on the timing, safety, and efficacy of treating severe symptomatic aortic and carotid stenosis. In the older population and in the presence of multiple comorbidities that arise during the surgery, a less invasive transcatheter treatment may be the only reasonable option. We discuss this topic by analyzing a case of an 84-year-old man who underwent a combined single-stage transcatheter procedure.
title: A Short Report on Single Stage Transcatheter Aortic Valve Replacement and Carotid Stenting.
journal: The Thoracic and cardiovascular surgeon reports
